definition[0]: to cut something, especially branches from a tree, usually with a single strong movement
example[0]: Workmen have lopped off more branches in an effort to save the tree.
definition[1]: to reduce an amount, especially of money, by a particular amount
example[1]: They lopped Â£16 off the price.
example[2]: Citicorp plans to lop $1.5 billion a year from its operating costs.
